meanings.definition: The act of financing a project or initiative jointly with another party.
meanings.sent1: The cofinancing of the new community center was a partnership between the city and a local charity.
meanings.sent2: The cofinancing agreement allowed both organizations to share the financial burden of the construction project.
meanings.sent3: The cofinancing of the school playground led to a fun and colorful play area for the children.
meanings.sent4: Their cofinancing arrangement was like a financial handshake, symbolizing their commitment to the project.
meanings.sent5: Through cofinancing, the two companies were able to achieve their goal of building affordable housing for the community.

meanings.definition: To provide funding for a project in collaboration with another entity.
meanings.sent1: The government decided to cofinance the infrastructure project with a private company.
meanings.sent2: We can cofinance the research study with our partners to ensure its success.
meanings.sent3: The idea to cofinance the event with a local business was a stroke of genius.
meanings.sent4: Cofinancing the charity event felt like joining forces for a greater cause.
meanings.sent5: By cofinancing the expedition, they were able to explore new territories together.
